After second spray my nose detected sweet scent with cherry and vanille. It's lovely scent I could wear in summer or winter. But one problem Is how weak It Is It works barely 4 max 5 hours.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="2198257"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=2198257#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2197562" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2197562" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="silverii"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2151284"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2151284.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="silverii" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2197562ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2197562" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2151284">silverii</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-23">06/23/24 18:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Some notes: I actually thought this one would smell way different than it actually does. Smells very ”Christmas fruitcake” from the second you spray it. It’s not synthetic, it actually smells really realistic and familiar. As I let it rest, it slowly becomes more of a mix between fruitcake and vanilla. To my nose, it’s very reminiscent of childhood Christmas in a way. A bit later, I get fruitcake, a bit of vanilla, a bit of tobacco, and some spices in the back. Gorgeous scent! If you’re not interested in buying, it’s worth to at least go test out! Very wonderful memories associated with this fragrance. Leans more unisex than expected, but imo can be worn by anyone who’s brave enough.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="2197562"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=2197562#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2195064" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2195064" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eaudemale"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191172"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1191172.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eaudemale" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Meteore-62251.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62251.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Météore"title="Météore"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2195064ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2195064" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191172">eaudemale</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-21">06/21/24 07:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I re smelled this recently.. I don’t recall it smelling like honey. To me it was a piping hot (in a warm way) vanilla ashy tobacco… did it always have this honey accord or was it reformulated?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="2195064"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=2195064#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2194751" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2194751" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rob-B-29"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1856434"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1856434.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rob-B-29" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montale/Arabians-Tonka-57384.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57384.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Arabians Tonka"title="Arabians Tonka"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2194751ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2194751" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1856434">Rob-B-29</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-20">06/20/24 21:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tobacco vanille by Tom Ford is a beautiful scent and is totally loved by the fragrance community and gets a lot of hype. It's a rich tobacco fragrance with spices in the top notes and is a bit of a vanilla bomb in the dry down with a little wood , but I don't get any of the other notes listed like the dry fruits or cacao. It's probably better wear in the colder seasons but can really be wore at anytime as long as it's not too hot or you'll be choking yourself and the people around you right out. 😂 But I totally love it and it has to be in one of my top five fragrances I have. 9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="2194751"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=2194751#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2194445" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2194445" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Om3r_perfumes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2140989"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2140989.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Om3r_perfumes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Halfeti-Cedar-64560.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64560.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Halfeti Cedar"title="Halfeti Cedar"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2194445ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2194445" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2140989">Om3r_perfumes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-20">06/20/24 13:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>In short this is the best smelling Tom ford fragrance by far. It’s honestly one of the best tobacco and sweet fragrances out there. It starts off more tobacco heavy and slowly turns into a more vanilla and gourmond esc scent. <br />
<br />
Tobacco Vanille is great for winter and fall. I would suggest this for date nights and even casual outings. This fragrance lasts about 9-10 hours and projects decently. <br />
<br />
But… Al Harmain’s Amber Oud Tobacco edition is the clone of tobacco vanille but is superior and at less than half the price. It has an extremely strong projection superior to tobacco vanille and a slightly longer longevity. And honestly even scent wise it’s slightly better and more complimented from my usage. And due to this clone, tobacco vanille is an overpriced scent. Although it’s amazing there is a significant superior scent at half the price.<br />
<br />
Scent: 10<br />
Longevity: 9<br />
Projection: 7<br />
Value: 4<br />
Overall: 8.5</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="2194445"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=2194445#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2193853" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2193853" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kristenboris1997"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1030934"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1030934.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kristenboris1997" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/Alien-Essence-Absolue-15452.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15452.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alien Essence Absolue"title="Alien Essence Absolue"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2193853ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2193853" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1030934">kristenboris1997</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-20">06/20/24 02:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've done a complete about turn on this one. I actually really love it. I still feel like its a scent of a smoker trying to perfume away the cigarette smell but its actually not bad. I love the spicy notes in the later stage/dry down. Love the tobacco and vanilla notes, how they blend somewhat seamlessly. I used to hate this one. Now it sits well on my skin. The cacao and powder come later. I love those notes. Guess things have changed with time and age.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="2193853"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=2193853#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2193337" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2193337" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Oxana123456789"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1836514"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1836514.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Oxana123456789" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Under-The-Lemon-Tree-53379.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53379.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Under The Lemon Tree"title="Under The Lemon Tree"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2193337ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2193337" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1836514">Oxana123456789</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-19">06/19/24 13:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was intrigued by all the hype, although I remember trying it once, before I knew it is popular, and I did not like it. Today I tried it again and no. I think, by now it is fair to conclude - I dislike Tom Ford’s creations. They all hide in not-see-through bottles and they just feel dirty to me and not in a good way. As if someone made a mess of sweet things, spilled booze, cigarettes, and all that mess stuck to someone’s leather jacket. This piece was cut out and extracted into perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="2193337"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=2193337#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2193223" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2193223" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NauticaVoyageFan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2114601"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2114601.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="NauticaVoyageFan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Crivelli/Oud-Cadenza-95195.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95195.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Cadenza"title="Oud Cadenza"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2193223ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2193223" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2114601">NauticaVoyageFan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-19">06/19/24 11:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tobacco Vanille by Tom Ford is in my opinion the only winter Tom Ford fragrance that is worth its hefty price point as it is an amazing combination of a soothing soft vanilla note that smells similar to white chocolate to me and a strong tobacco note that makes this a tad bit more masculine and strong and overall this smells amazingly. The price just like any Tom Ford fragrance is quite high at $445 retail but this can be justified due to its amazing smell and good longevity.<br />
<br />
On my skin, this can last for 9-12 hours which is beneficial for those half-day activities and its consistency in its longevity is outstanding as well so I wouldn't worry about this fragrance slowly fading away on your skin or clothes. The sillage is better than expected as well as this can leave a good scent trail and can be smelled a couple feet away as well.<br />
<br />
Scent: 9/10<br />
Performance: 8/10<br />
Longevity: 9/10<br />
Sillage: 7/10<br />
Price: 5/10<br />
Blind Buy Safe: 8/10<br />
Overall: 9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="2193223"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=2193223#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2193196" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
Longevity I only got 4 days then it became a skin scent.<br />
Projection is maximum 200km, I’ve got a friend in Japan and he only got a faint whiff in the air.<br />
<br />
Phenomenal fragrance!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="1266296"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=1266296#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent919683" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc919683" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gabler"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1068757"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1068757.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gabler" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Laine-de-Verre-22964.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.22964.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Laine de Verre"title="Laine de Verre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma919683ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd919683" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1068757">Gabler</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-03-08">03/08/18 09:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It´s a little bit difficult to write down this review because of those feelings inside. I don´t want to be much personal, just sincere - because this is the scent of my love &amp; our home. <br />
<br />
For me, there is something very familiar about this perfume. It reminds me of my life, my memories, my man. All the cigarettes he smoked while he was listening to my stories. Fluffy vanilla latte on Sunday mornings, the taste of Old English dark fruit cake that I have been baking every Christmas. Hennessy cognac for goodnight /while we were listening to our favorite song - Change Is Gonna Come/.<br />
<br />
Sweet home, sweet times. <br />
<br />
Tobacco, cigarette smoke, cigar ash, delicately sweet vanilla, dried fruits, cloves, cinnamon - that´s what I love, what I want, what I need. That is Tobacco Vanille.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="919683"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=919683#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1025549" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1025549" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Saeka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1075357"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1075357.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Saeka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Sunshine-Woman-28182.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28182.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sunshine Woman"title="Sunshine Woman"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1025549ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1025549" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1075357">Saeka</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-29">01/29/19 01:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Friends, please be aware of FAKE TOBACCO VANILLE on eBay. The worst fake perfume I’ve ever seen arrived from <br />
<br />
best.natural.store2018 (151)<br />
95.5% positive Feedback<br />
Member since 2016<br />
Location:Bulgaria<br />
<br />
It says located in Bulgaria but actually US. I should have known.<br />
<br />
I will re-buy TV from TOM FORD BOUTIQUE from now on. I’m sorry for posting here but I thought nesessary.<br />
Peace (*^^*)ノ</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="1025549"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=1025549#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent970424" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc970424" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Raidthesaladbar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/659619"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.659619.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Raidthesaladbar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma970424ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd970424" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/659619">Raidthesaladbar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-08-10">08/10/18 04:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>By now we have all come to the consensus that Tobacco Vanille is brilliant/mediocre/horrible (delete where appropriate). This being said, I'd like to briefly talk about a tangential issue concerning this fragrance, which is the following:<br />
<br />
tobacco (eng.) vanille (fr.)<br />
<br />
What am I to make of this? How do I pronounce it? Switching accents halfway through is inadvisable, since even my friends from <i>Nouvelle-Orléans</i> choke on their Diet Coke whenever I correctly pronounce "Guerlain" in the middle of an English sentence. No, you have to commit to one only. <br />
<br />
My first option is, then, to leave "vanille" as it's supposed to be (French) and say the English word "tobacco" with an exaggerated Jean-Reno-style accent. However, I find it cumbersome to lug around the silk béret and fake moustache which are necessary to channel the appropriate level of pretentiousness.<br />
<br />
Alternatively, you can follow TF's marketing and pronounce the whole thing in English - like a clueless American tourist clutching his phrase book in a Parisian café ("Oooh ay le Starbucks?"), blissfully unaware of the savage beating the waiter is fantasising about behind his smile.<br />
<br />
Perhaps this is all some <i>grand œuvre de trollage</i> - Mr. Ford snickering into his computer screen as he watches reviewers humiliate themselves trying to pronounce his fragrance names. If that's the intent though, I suggest he take a page out of Hermès' book and go all out. In this age of Youtube, <i>Un Jardin en Méditerranée</i> still ranks as the funniest fragrance I've ever come across.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="970424"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=970424#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1311938" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1311938" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="angela2394"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1317599"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1317599.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="angela2394" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1311938ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1311938" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1317599">angela2394</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-22">03/22/21 07:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume just screams “ I GOT MONEYYYYYYYY, AND I’M LETTING YOU KNOW”.<br />
Heads will be turned wearing this perfume. A man wearing this perfume going out with his guy friends, will get the most attention. Everyone will look at him when the ober askes who to give the bill to.<br />
A Woman wearing this perfume just screams “ I’m independent, and can take good care of myself “.<br />
Wearing this scent to a normal 9-5 job will have your coworkers think you don’t need this job, and that you got stacks of money. LOL<br />
The notes I pickup are: Spices, Vanilla, Cacao , Tobacco, and a little hint of Fruit wich makes the perfect blend.<br />
I would personally wear this fragrance in the winter time or when I know that I will be in an airconditioned room. It last 8+ hours on my skin. <br />
<br />
Although this is the perfect fragrance, it is NOT for the weak !!!<br />
<br />
5/5 Star</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="1311938"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=1311938#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="1825" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent901045" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc901045" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maureen.mccabe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1113777"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1113777.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="maureen.mccabe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma901045ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd901045" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1113777">maureen.mccabe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-01-15">01/15/18 16:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>After wearing the delicious Tobacco Vanille sample for a couple weeks, I decided I was tired of smelling like a burnt vanilla cupcake. I got bored. Same story with Cafe Rose.<br />
<br />
Tom Ford fragrances are long-lasting and initially enjoyable, but they lack complexity. Love the design of the bottle, but that isn't nearly as important as what's inside.<br />
<br />
It's like dating that hunky handsome guy you've always dreamed of, and then realizing he has no deeper qualities and is, in fact, a very shallow and boring person to be around. You know you could never fall in love with a guy like that.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="901045"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=901045#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent179398" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc179398" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scentrist"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8051"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.8051.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scentrist" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Initio-Parfums-Prives/Oud-for-Greatness-53641.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53641.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud for Greatness"title="Oud for Greatness"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma179398ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd179398" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8051">Scentrist</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-09-06">09/06/11 18:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So what can I say that hasn't already been said about Tobacco Vanille? Probably a lot.<br />
<br />
If you want to duplicate TV, here's what you do: Go to your local grocery.  Get a bottle of decent vanilla extract (ok, even the really chemical smelling fake stuff might do in a pinch), add a touch of cinnamon, chai spice, ground ginger and some ground cocoa. Combine, decant, and spray.  You'll smell like cookies, but you won't smell much different than the linear lines of this fragrance. And you'll save roughly $190.<br />
<br />
Seriously, the over-emphasis on the wrong note is often what plagues Tom Ford's other scents as well (as much as I appreciate Amber Absolute, the emphasis on incense tends to overwhelm the amber). Here, the tobacco is a missing element or mere footnote in what should have been a well-orchestrated symphony.  For so much promise, so little is experienced. This is a syrupy sweet confection that a walk around the mall will make kids wonder where the waffles are being served. This is far too linear, very unimaginative, synthetic-smelling and lacking in the focal ingredient. Too many others have done tobacco in a much more appreciable way, Serge Lutens Fumerie Turque comes to mind, Creed Tabarome not far behind. I can appreciate many of the Private Blend fragrances, but this completely misses the mark.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="179398"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=179398#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent424772" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc424772" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="misssarah"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/529525"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="misssarah" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Voyage-d-Hermes-7916.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.7916.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Voyage d'Hermes"title="Voyage d'Hermes"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma424772ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd424772" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/529525">misssarah</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-11-09">11/09/13 10:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To me, this smells exactly like the waft of synthetic vanilla you get when walking into a craft store like Michael's, or like Christmas room spray. I understand Tom Ford is supposed to use high quality ingredients, but I honestly wouldn't be able to tell the difference between this and a cheap vanilla candle in a blind sniff test.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="424772"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=424772#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent715933" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc715933" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Malenkig"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/983392"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Malenkig" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Floraiku/The-Moon-and-I-46166.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46166.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Moon and I"title="The Moon and I"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma715933ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd715933" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/983392">Malenkig</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-06-17">06/17/16 23:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I realize this review will be unpopular, but here goes:<br />
<br />
When smelling the cap alone, I got a promising, rich tobacco scent, laced with a small but dry vanilla. Spraying however left me with an overly sweet and slightly nauseating scent that began as a vanilla scented IKEA candle and over the course of an hour turned more and more akin to slightly stale Dr. Pepper. There were other scents of course (sugar that with age has fused into one big lump, fudge, soda that's turned flat) but Dr. Pepper dominated my experience with this perfume.<br />
<br />
It wasn't just me. The day (there wont be another) that I wore this scent, was my sisters birthday, and so I got several opinions from her friends at her birthday party. These were fairly evenly distributed between the subtle disapproval ("Ohh... I'm more of a floral person, I guess...") and the downright comical recoil and retching I got from her boyfriend in particular.<br />
<br />
Normally I tend to think a scent just doesn't react well with my skin, when I stumble upon something this bad. However, reading the reviews here I'm leaning more towards that a reformulation took place, and that it removed everything (some tobacco notes for example) that wasn't super sweet in this fragrance. Whats left is poorly balanced and sadly nauseating.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="715933"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=715933#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1241700" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1241700" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Birnam_Wood"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1061235"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1061235.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Birnam_Wood" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1241700ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1241700" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1061235">Birnam_Wood</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-10-26">10/26/20 18:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>-<br />
<br />
<b>话梅 “huamei”</b>, an Asian snack made of pickled ume/preserved plum: this is exactly what Tobacco Vanille smells like. Ask any east or southeast Asian you know, they'll agree.<br />
<br />
I googled a little more, then found what's responsible for that distinctive scent of huamei(=Tobacco Vanille):<br />
<br />
<b>Licorice.</b><br />
<br />
To replicate this scent with 100% precision, first you need some extremely <b>tart fruits</b>, too sour to be eat alone, let them <b>dried up with salt</b>,  treat them with a shit load of <b>licorice</b>,  sprinkle them with <b>cinnamon and clove</b> powder, and round off the rough edges with <b>vanillin</b>: now you got the perfect Tobacco Vanille opening.<br />
<br />
The latter half of the journey, if you ask me, mimics another Asian drink: <b>rose oolong tea</b>.<br />
<br />
Oolong tea is a type of half fermented "black" black tea, smells incredibly <b>dry and bitter</b> with a whiff of "rusty" fermented hint<br />
<br />
Getting close to your skin, the <b>bitter and dried core</b> of Tobacco Vanille smells exactly like dried oolong tea leaves; smells from afar, it has a <b>hidden rosy aura</b>.<br />
<br />
The dry down has lost its shape, just a vague mix of all aforementioned notes, maybe adding some oily-coconut-y coumarin, along with a few drop of honey adding a little depth and animalic hint.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="1825"comment_id="1241700"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html?ccid=1241700#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="1825" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="1825":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="1825" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300 __728x90" id="fragranticacom_perfume_footer" v-pre>
</div></div></div>
            </div>
    <div class="small-12 medium-4 large-3 cell" data-sticky-container>

                    class="off-canvas in-canvas-for-large position-right is-closed"
             data-off-canvas>

        </button>&nbsp;

</div>                        <div id="popBrands" class="strike-title" style="margin-top: 4em;"><span>Most Popular Perfumes</span></div>

        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
        <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">

            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Khamrah-75805.html" class="en2inter">Khamrah Lattafa Perfumes</a>
        </span>
    </div>

        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">

    </div>

        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

    </div>

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>

    });
</script>
<script>(function(){function c(){var b=a.contentDocument||a.contentWindow.document;if(b){var d=b.createElement('script');d.innerHTML="window.__CF$cv$params={r:'8eda7d658a35ef10',t:'MTczMzQ2OTM3OS4wMDAwMDA='};var a=document.createElement('script');a.nonce='';a.src='/cdn-cgi/challenge-platform/scripts/jsd/main.js';document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(a);";b.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(d)}}if(document.body){var a=document.createElement('iframe');a.height=1;a.width=1;a.style.position='absolute';a.style.top=0;a.style.left=0;a.style.border='none';a.style.visibility='hidden';document.body.appendChild(a);if('loading'!==document.readyState)c();else if(window.addEventListener)document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded',c);else{var e=document.onreadystatechange||function(){};document.onreadystatechange=function(b){e(b);'loading'!==document.readyState&&(document.onreadystatechange=e,c())}}}})();</script></body>
</html>
